image.altText: Alex Carey takes the bails off as Ben Stokes stretches towards the crease

items.synopsis: Australia must make inroads into England's batting card or risk the hosts build up a big first innings lead on day three of the fourth Ashes Test in Manchester. Follow live.

title.children: Australia needs quick wickets in fourth Ashes Test at damp Old Trafford

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Well, that's pretty interesting. Despite a couple of aggressive shots, the run rate hasn't been rapid, and now Stokes is gone, chopping onto his stumps as he tries to work from outside off to the leg side. Stokes is furious with himself, whacking the ground with his bat as he walks off. Out comes Jonny Bairstow, with a job to do.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: CUMMINS BOWLS STOKES!

children.content: Well, that's pretty interesting. Despite a couple of aggressive shots, the run rate hasn't been rapid, and now Stokes is gone, chopping onto his stumps as he tries to work from outside off to the leg side.
Stokes is furious with himself, whacking the ground with his bat as he walks off.
Out comes Jonny Bairstow, with a job to do.

image.altText: Three crashed vehicles with police at scene.

items.synopsis: Three people were killed in the crash after an Isuzu, which police alleged was stolen at knifepoint, was seen chasing and ramming another vehicle onto the wrong side of the highway.

title.children: Triple highway fatality being treated as a domestic violence homicide investigation

image.altText: Three Nigeria teammates celebrate with Chiamaka Nnadozie after the Women's World Cup match against Canada.

items.synopsis: Spurred on by vibrant support from its fans, Nigeria frustrates Canada in a 0-0 draw at the World Cup, proving the Super Falcons will be a dangerous opponent when they face the Matildas next week.

title.children: Nigeria shows why Matildas need to be on guard at the World Cup

image.altText: A pile of australian coins on a yellow backdrop.

items.synopsis: Inflation might be softening in some places around the world, but the price of things like groceries remains high.

title.children: Inflation is falling in Australia and New Zealand. Here's how we stack up with the rest of the world

image.altText: Man stand in front of trees in the background with a black hat and jumper on

items.synopsis: Alice Springs Mayor Matt Paterson says the announcement that alcohol restrictions the town would continue for at least a further 12 months came as a "shock".

title.children: 'Kicking the can down the road': Alice Springs advocates call for support beyond alcohol restrictions

image.altText: A chain of verdant islands sit in a bright blue and green sea, as seen in an aerial picture.

items.synopsis: A Palauan newspaper publisher entered into a media deal with a company that turned out to have connections to Chinese security services. Although the agreement fell through, it highlights China's efforts to influence the Pacific states — including Palau, a US ally and one of the few countries to recognise Taiwan.

title.children: Failed Palau media deal reveals China's Pacific influence efforts

image.altText: Victorian police car with lights on

items.synopsis: Victoria Police's Homicide Squad and Professional Standards Command are investigating after a man was critically injured during an arrest in Melbourne's south.

title.children: Man critical after being tasered and shot with bean bag rounds after Melbourne siege

image.altText: photo of shark next to man holding fishing gear

items.synopsis: A father shares the moment he "hugged" a shark and shot it in the eye with a spear near Coral Bay to avoid being bitten, as his helpless family watched from a boat.

title.children: Spearfisher hugs shark to escape 'horrible' attack in WA — and escapes with only bruises

image.altText: Coles milk prices up to $1.10 a litre

items.synopsis: Farmers and the nation's competition watchdog are worried about a deal that could see Coles control a large part of the milk supply chain.

title.children: 'Extremely scary': Dairy farmers, ACCC concerned about Coles' bid to buy milk processing plants

image.altText: A sunburnt, man with grey beard stands shirtless on a boat with the Australian flag.

items.synopsis: After 86 days at sea, Rob Barton is believed to be the first person to row non-stop solo and unassisted across the Indian Ocean from Australia to Africa.

title.children: Man rows from Australia to Africa to raise funds for youth mental health

image.altText: A young Asian woman with long dark hair poses for a selfie.

items.synopsis: The court heard Joon Seong Tan murdered Melbourne woman Ju 'Kelly' Zhang in a jealous rage, then let her eight-year-old son believe she had left him.

title.children: 'Simply cruel': Judge sentences man who murdered his girlfriend and dumped her body in a wheelie bin

image.altText: A smartphone with Facebook's logo is seen in front of displayed Facebook's new rebrand logo Meta in this illustration

items.synopsis: Inspired by Australian laws to make social media giants pay for access to news content, Canada says it is enduring "bullying" tactics from tech companies who oppose the legislation.

title.children: Canadian government and businesses pull advertising from Facebook after company blocks news from feeds

image.altText: An image of a phot,o of Reuben Button, a metal box and ceremonial items

items.synopsis: Prisoners at a privately run jail — one of the largest in NSW— should not receive "sub-optimal" medical care, according to a state Coroner.

title.children: Inmate received 'second-rate medical care' before his death, inquest finds

image.altText: A close-up of an ant grooming itself

items.synopsis: The discovery of red fire ants in the Tallebudgera Valley has reignited calls for urgent action to be taken to prevent the pest's spread into New South Wales.

title.children: Discovery of red fire ants 5km from NSW border sparks fresh calls for boost to state and federal eradication funding

image.altText: A screenshot of an Adelaide Review article in Spanish.

items.synopsis: Spanish opinion polling and data analysis has been posted to the defunct cultural magazine The Adelaide Review, in apparent attempt to circumvent Spanish electoral laws ahead of the country's upcoming general election.

title.children: Defunct Adelaide publication posts Spanish election poll results ahead of vote

image.altText: A close-up picture of Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews looking thoughtful.

items.synopsis: From tearing up the East West Link contract at a cost of more than a billion dollars, to cancelling the Commonwealth Games this week, the Andrews government is no stranger to budget blowouts. Analysts say the scale of projects and underestimating costs may be part of the problem.

title.children: Calls for greater transparency as Andrews government's project cost blowouts stack up

image.altText: Spanish players cheer and hug each other on the pitch.

items.synopsis: Spain quickly take the lead in their World Cup opener against Costa Rica, who deliver the first own goal of the tournament. Look back at all the updates on and off the pitch with our blog.

title.children: Spain makes statement with World Cup win over Costa Rica

image.altText: Meningococcal vaccines in a fridge

items.synopsis: SA Health says it has identified multiple people who had contact with the man and have directed them to take clearance antibiotics, as a 15-year-old is also admitted to hospital with the disease in a stable condition.

title.children: Man dies from invasive meningococcal in SA, child in hospital with the disease

image.altText: Bare branches covering a large beige building in the background

items.synopsis: The Adelaide District Court heard the 36-year-old created an Instagram account pretending to be a 16-year-old boy and exchanged more than 215,000 messages with children, but never met his victims.

title.children: Former RAAF intelligence officer sentenced over child exploitation material

image.altText: Indian PM Modi speaks to the parliament.

items.synopsis: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi condemns the alleged sexual assault of women in Manipur state as "shameful", promising tough action in his first comments on ethnic clashes in the remote north-east that have killed at least 125 people.

title.children: Modi breaks silence after video of women assaulted, paraded naked through streets in Manipur emerges

image.altText: Police surround a man wearing a tradie uniform as he stands next to a silver ute

items.synopsis: Police say a man is assisting them with enquiries, after the child was picked up in an unknown vehicle while walking to school.

title.children: Footage released of the moment police swoop on man following alleged abduction of girl on way to school

image.altText: A row of houses in a river

items.synopsis: The Victorian government is offering a $150 million regional worker accommodation package after cancelling the Commonwealth Games. But will communities that have already found their own staff housing solutions get a share?

title.children: These Vic tourist towns made their own staff housing. Will they get a slice of the state's new accommodation fund?

image.altText: Happiness

items.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers releases a long-awaited wellbeing report but admits there are "gaps" in the data and says he is "open to feedback".

title.children: First 'wellbeing budget' finds Australians are living longer but they are less satisfied

image.altText: A woman looks sad while sitting on an esky on the sidelines.

items.synopsis: Tony Gustavsson says the secrecy surrounding Sam Kerr's injury was partly about tactics, as questions are raised about how long the Matildas star will be out.

title.children: Matildas coach explains secrecy around Kerr injury in 'tough 24 hours' before World Cup opener

image.altText: A soldier stands in the foreground with a missile launcher parked atop a hill, ready to fire.

items.synopsis: Japan's top military officer General Yoshihide Yoshida is in Australia inspecting his country's most advanced anti-ship weapon as part of his country's largest ever participation in Exercise Talisman Sabre.

title.children: Japan's top general inspects anti-ship missile ahead of historic Australian launch

image.altText: Three crashed vehicles with police at scene.

items.synopsis: Three people were killed in the crash after an Isuzu, which police alleged was stolen at knifepoint, was seen chasing and ramming another vehicle onto the wrong side of the highway.

title.children: Triple highway fatality being treated as a domestic violence homicide investigation

image.altText: Raghe Mohammed Abdi smiles a the camera. He wears a school uniform consisting of a maroon jacket and tie, and a blue shirt.

items.synopsis: Police said, when they offered to help Mr Abdi — who was walking alongside a busy motorway — he yelled and ran at them with a knife.

title.children: Police opened fire fearing their lives were in danger when man ran at them with a knife, inquest told

image.altText: a giant box of cadbury creme eggs

items.synopsis: Joby Pool admitted to breaking into an industrial complex to steal the chocolate treats.

title.children: British man who stole 200,000 Cadbury Creme Eggs to spend more than a year in jail

image.altText: An underwater photo of a whale tangled in pearling lines

items.synopsis: Rescuers have told of their joy at freeing an 11-metre humpback whale stuck in pearling lines for three days off the WA coast, the second to become entangled near Broome since the weekend.

title.children: Humpback whale freed from pearling lines off Kimberley coast

image.altText: A security surveillance camera is seen near the Microsoft office building in Beijing.

items.synopsis: Beijing-linked hackers access US Ambassador to China Nicholas Burns's email account in an espionage operation thought to have compromised at least hundreds of thousands of individual US government emails, the Wall Street Journal and CNN report.

title.children: Chinese hackers breach US ambassador's emails in Microsoft hack, reports say

image.altText: A police officer stands next to a parked police car on a road in a forested area.

items.synopsis: Residents in nearby areas were told to stay indoors as police tried to track the animal down using helicopters, drones and infrared cameras.

title.children: Police continue to search for suspected lioness on the loose in Berlin

image.altText: A white woman wearing a green blouse, with shoulder-length blonde hair, looks steadily at the camera.

items.synopsis: Japan's sole custody laws have long been criticised for incentivising child abduction, but the system may be about to change, with Australia playing a key role behind the scenes.

title.children: For four years, Catherine has fought Japan's highest court to be reunited with her children

image.altText: A Yes23 volunteer hands out shirts in Surry Hills' Prince Alfred Park at the Come Together For Yes rally

items.synopsis: Conjecture appeared on social media this week suggesting Labor MPs were offering 'bribes' in the form of grants to community organisations to become active in campaigning for a Voice.

title.children: Why this screenshot of a Yes campaign email does not equal 'bribes paid by the taxpayer'

image.altText: A man with tan skin, a moustache and blue shirt is holding up a large cheque and smiling which says lucky player sold here

items.synopsis: What happens to instant millionaires and billionaires once they receive news of their lotto win?

title.children: So you just won big on the lottery, how much do you actually get to keep?

image.altText: A black and white photo of a Chinese navy ship.

items.synopsis: Officials are preparing for two Chinese "spy ships" to arrive off Australia's coast next week to monitor the multinational Talisman Sabre military exercises opening in Sydney this morning.

title.children: Chinese 'spy ships' expected off NT and Queensland during Talisman Sabre military exercises
